column4: errr... guys, I have a file with a number on the beginning of each line, from 2 to 960... anyone knows a way to delete them?
and after that number? a space allways ?
an "enter" letter I guess
and then a space
enter ? so each number is in its own line?
see my private message
http://paste.ubuntu.com/446173/
grep -v '^[0-9]' file > file.new
great, I didn't know how to do it but I think I understand the command !
if some other usefull line begins with a number thwen it will be deleted too
Yes i got that thanks, but I don't think that any php line can begin with a number...
grep -E '^[0-9]+$' file > file.new
that will work better
sorry --> grep -vE '^[0-9]+$' file > file.new
ok, thanks :D
it's has exactly the same result, thanks :D
Yes it doesn't
if you have some technical question about your ati card, please /join #ati
you surely want to talk to BrixSat
did you know that MSI wants to abandon bios?
read about it, efi is still a bios ( modern one but still bios/firmware )
it's a firmware, not a bios, and uses C, not assembly
